Telegrams : Standards, Sowest, London. Telephone : Abbey 3333 PREFACE T HIS YEARBOOK contains a list of British Standards in numerical order, a subject index and some info i mation on the work of the B.S.l. up to December 31st, 1945. The Institution’s Monthly Infoimation Sheets will keep the numerical list of British Standards up-to-date, and a pocket has been provided at the back of this Yearbook for the con- venience of filing the sheets. The inclusion in the Yearbook of lists of the members of Industry Committees has been resumed. In addition to the Yearbook and the Monthly Information Sheets, the B.S.l. issues an Annual Report and Standards Review, a periodical in popular form. These publications are free to subscribing members. Particulars of membership can be obtained on application. BRITISH STANDARDS INSTITUTION President : The RJght Hon. Sir Frank Gill, K.C.M.G., Co-opted O.B.E. 47 AIMS AND OBJECTS rite British Standards Institution is the national organisation for the jromulgation of British Standard terms, definitions, codes of practice and ipecifications for materials, articles, etc., and methods of test. It is go\erned )y a General Council, the constitution of which is given on page 3. The underlying principles covering the preparation of British Standards ire : (a) that they shall be in accordance with the needs of industry and fulfil i generally recognised want ; (b) that the interest of both producer and consumer shall be considered ; (c) that periodic review shall be undertaken. SUBSCRIBING MEMBERSHIP Subscribers of £2 2s. Od. per annum are entitled to 10 copies per annum any British Standards published at the usual price of 2s. per copy, or to ;he equivalent in British Standards issued at other prices. Subscribers of £5 5s. Od. per annum are entitled to 50 copies per annum Df any British Standards published at the usual price of 2s. per copy, or to the equivalent in British Standards issued at other prices. Subscribers of £10 10s. Od. per annum are entitled to 1 20 copies per annum of any British Standards published at the usual price of 2s. per copy, or to the equivalent in British Standards issued at other prices. In the case of subscribers of over £10 10s. Od. per annum, special arrangements are made. Subscribing members also receive, free of charge : B.S.L Yearbook , which includes a numerical and subject index, and an abstract of every British Standard issued. Monthly Information Sheet , which records the issue during the month of : New and revised British Standards. Draft British Standards and Codes of Practice issued for comment. New work started. New oversea standards available in the B.S.L Library. Copy of each issue of Standards Review , Standards Review is an illustrated periodical on industrial standardisation in this country and abroad. Additional copies of all the institution’s publications are supplied to subscribing members at a discount of 33% per cent, except in the case of Standards Review, for which the discount is 50 per cent, and of the Monthly Information Sheet, which is free. Drafts of British Standards are also free to subscribing members. Handbooks containing bound copies of a number of British Standards are available to subscribing members at the published price, less 33 % per cent. Special arrangements can be made for industrial and trade associations to become members on payment of a block contribution. By agreement with the Board of Inland Revenue, subscriptions to the Institution are accepted as a trade expense. 48 SECTIONAL LISTS The following sectional lists of British Standards are available on application free of charge : Aircraft materials and components Building Comprehensive scheme of codes of practice for building (prepared by the Codes of Practice Committee) Chemical engineering Chemicals, fats, oils, scientific apparatus, etc. Cinematography and photography Coal, coke and colliery requisites Dairying Electrical engineering Gas and solid fuel Glassware, including scientific apparatus and lighting fittings Hardware Illumination and lighting fittings Iron and steel Mechanical engineering Nomenclature, symbols and abbreviations Non-ferrous metals Packaging and containers Paints, varnishes, paint ingredients and colours for paints, etc. Personal safety equipment Public works, road engineering, elc„ Rubber Shipbuilding Textiles and clothing Universal decimal classification LIBRARY A complete set of British Standards is available for reference in the B.S.L Library, which is open to visitors from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m., except Saturdays. Copies of standards issued by various national standards organisations in the Dominions, United States of America, Europe and South America are also on file. European standards published during the war years are now being obtained, and all Library accessions are listed in the Monthly Information Sheets.
